newsitem.title: UK: Coda shares jump 10 pct on profit, outlook.
newsitem.headline: Coda shares jump 10 pct on profit, outlook.

text.p: Shares in Coda Group Plc rallied to three-month highs after the supplier of accounting systems said it returned to profitability for the first half of its fiscal year and was optimistic for the next six months.
Shares were up 11.5p at 140p at 1100 GMT after reaching a high of 143p. The stock is still well below a peak of 290.5p touched in March 1996.
The company said it registered a pre-tax profit of 60,000 stg in the six months ended April 30, versus a loss of 3.7 million stg in the same period a year ago.
The company said it was "cautiously optimistic" and saw progress in restoring profitability at year end.
"I think the figures were a little better than expected and the outlook is quite good," one trader said.
"I think it is mostly that the statement read very well and it looks like they may have turned the corner and certainly the future looks brighter," he said.
